alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued November 20 at 8:49PM AKST until November 21 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...STRONG WINTER STORM WILL CONTINUE TO IMPACT THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE PANHANDLE ... As of 8 pm, snow reports from around Southeast Alaska have ranged from 6 to 21 inches with this system. The rain-snow will steadily move north through the night with major accumulations ending by morning for all but the far northern inner channels. High winds in downtown Juneau will persist overnight, resulting in continued blizzard conditions there. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions at times for downtown Juneau and Douglas. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. The Mendenhall Valley and along the highway north of Auke Bay are just receiving snow. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
